issues.description: The problem statement explicitly requires ExcellenceLand to have a private attribute 'rides' of type List<Ride> (and to provide public getters). In the solution, the 'rides' attribute is declared public (public List<Ride> rides;). This contradicts the specified visibility in the exercise and breaks encapsulation; students comparing the solution or relying on it as a reference could be confused, and automated checks that expect a private field may fail.
issues.suggested_fix: Declare the 'rides' attribute as private in the solution (and in the template implementation students will complete). For example: private List<Ride> rides; Keep the constructor signature and public getter (getRides()) as in the solution so behavior matches the specification while restoring the required visibility.
